Description: Black and white granite amulet in the shape of a wedjat-eye without design, pierced lengthwise.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, if not from Tell Nabasha or any other Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886. If from Tell Dafana, possibly one of the"fifteen symbolic eyes (...) of grey syenite", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70. See London, BM, EA 18556, similar and Bristol H1165.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.59, p.179, pl.21)
